meanings.definition: A person who goes about in search of plunder; a pirate or marauder.
meanings.sent1: The freebooters sailed the seas in search of treasure.
meanings.sent2: The freebooters were feared by all the sailors in the region.
meanings.sent3: The freebooters tried to steal the captain's hat but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The freebooters were like shadows, appearing out of nowhere to take what they wanted.
meanings.sent5: The freebooters' flag struck fear into the hearts of all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks to profit by the freebooting of others.
meanings.sent1: The freebooters in the market always looked for ways to make money quickly.
meanings.sent2: The freebooters took advantage of the chaos to enrich themselves.
meanings.sent3: The freebooters tried to sell fake treasure maps to unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: The freebooters' schemes were like a web, trapping those who fell for their tricks.
meanings.sent5: The freebooters' pockets were always full of ill-gotten gains.
